intro: Argemone ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow argemone, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. The seeds are enclosed in a capsule and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution.
